page.title: 09The Village Primary School-1
page.content: This block is served by two rural Primary schools - at Lower Hardres and Petham. The roll at the former school was approximately 20 and the latter 63 during the Summer Term of 1985. Recent economies in education expenditure has reduced Petham's staff from 3 full- time teachers and a part-timer for 7.5 hours per week to 2 full-time teachers and part-timers for 20 hours per week. (The Head is included as a teacher as he teaches almost full-time). The curriculum includes all those areas expected of a primary school but with an emphasis on small group work or individual instruction as there can be between 2 & 4 year age groups in a particular class. Reading, English & Mathematics can be considered as core areas of the curriculum and skills here are developed in other areas of work too.
